intro: Randia armigera, commonly known as the redroot sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a rough texture. Randia armigera is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
